timeline.bodyText: Can you file an issue for this one?  I believe we should have some kind of access control on SHOW GRANTS FOR TABLE.  My guess would be you can always see your own grants, or if you are the owner, you can see all grants... or maybe the "with grant option".  We'll need to look it up in the spec.
timeline.author: dain

replies.bodyText: Currently, it is only implemented for hive.security=sql-standard. If you have SET ROLE admin then you display all table privileges, otherwise you display only session user grants.
replies.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText: Maybe we should have something like filterTablePrivileges or filterGrants. The same thing goes to listing roles I think. In both cases, it is currently handled in sql-standard access control directy.
replies.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText: Having that said, I don't think there is anything actionable to be logged for today.
replies.author: kokosing
